meanings.definition: A style or trend that deliberately opposes or rejects mainstream fashion.
meanings.sent1: She embraced antifashion by wearing mismatched socks and vintage clothes.
meanings.sent2: The antifashion movement gained popularity among young people looking for unique styles.
meanings.sent3: At the party, everyone was dressed in fancy outfits except for Sarah, who proudly displayed her antifashion look.
meanings.sent4: Her bold choice to wear pajamas to a formal event was a statement of antifashion rebellion.
meanings.sent5: The runway show featured models flaunting the latest antifashion designs, challenging traditional norms.

meanings.definition: A person who actively resists or goes against current fashion trends.
meanings.sent1: As an antifashion, he refused to follow the latest clothing fads and instead created his own unique style.
meanings.sent2: The antifashion stood out in a crowd of trend followers with their unconventional attire.
meanings.sent3: The antifashion at the event wore a tuxedo t-shirt, causing many to chuckle at the playful defiance of fashion norms.
meanings.sent4: She was a true antifashion, always challenging the status quo of the fashion industry.
meanings.sent5: In a sea of designer labels, the antifashion's thrift store ensemble made a memorable statement.
